title: 'Obsessive' prison officer who bombarded terrified ex with calls is suspended
text:

An "obsessive" prison officer who bombarded his terrified ex-girlfriend with phone calls and texts has been suspended from his job.

Joe Pattie was "manipulative, controlling and a pathological liar", said his former partner, Blayre Howie, after he admitted to a campaign of harassment that went on for about six months.

Pattie turned up at Ms Howie's home and work, and would call her up to 70 times and text her up to 50 times a day abusing her or begging her to take him back.

But despite her complaints to private firm Serco he held on to his job at HMP Kilmarnock until the Daily Record exposed his abuse.

(Image: Daily Record)

Serco claims it "took all the appropriate steps necessary" when the matter was reported to the company earlier this year.

Messages obtained by the Record show Pattie relentlessly contacted mum-of-one Ms Howie.

Ms Howie, 23, said she complained to Serco three times about Pattie, also 23, contacting her from work and made a complaint in January.

She said: "Once I had 70 missed calls from HMP Kilmarnock. I had to block the number."

(Image: Daily Record)

In one voicemail, he said: "F****** phone me. I've not f****** messaged her. You're f****** leaving me here, it's ridiculous."

At Kilmarnock Sheriff Court last month, Pattie admitted placing his former partner in a state of fear or alarm between July 2017 and January this year.

He is due to be sentenced this month.

Ms Howie said: "He was obsessive, manipulative, controlling and a pathological liar.

(Image: Daily Record)

"I had no choice but to contact the police as he wouldn't leave me alone and his work wouldn't do anything.

"But even after admitting everything in court, he still had his job. It was like what he did didn't matter.

"He was a prison officer helping look after people who were in jail for doing a lot less than what he did to me.

"I don't know how Serco could even guarantee his safety or that of his colleagues if inmates found out that he had been convicted too."

Pattie, of Kilmarnock, did not respond to the Record's request for comment.

Michael Guy, Serco's prison director at HMP Kilmarnock, said: "When this matter was brought to our attention earlier in the year, we took all the appropriate steps necessary at that time.

"It is now a matter for the police and the courts."
description: Prison officer Joe Pattie, 23, would call Blayre Howie, 23, up to 70 times a day and turn up at her home and work in Kilmarnock
